metadata.description:
PINEAPPLE CRUSH was written on a summer's day in LA, riding the wave of a hangover and letting the ease of the sun run through me. 

After taking the uber from the party in the morning my mind was at ease and able to focus on nothing but the cars passing by. 

I had written the lyric  "you came on strong like the sun on my back"  about a week prior to going out for the night. When the day came to write PINEAPPLE with Oscar Scheller it seemed to be the perfect spine of our song. 

I was listening to Wild Thoughts by Rihanna and DJ Khaled pretty relentlessly so I think that was also a strong gene in this songs DNA.

Oscar was in the UK at the time but he know's the Cali vibe. We started and finished the whole song over facetime. The vocals were even recorded on my phone in the voice memo app and sent to him whilst we were worlds away. 

Blue May mixed her and had her ready for the summer

lyrics.text:
License plate from Indiana 
forgive me I’ve left all my manners 
deep in my secrets i see you in love
Maybe i’m there to i cant even front

you can pretend i’m rihanna 
play with me like you’re santana
never could shake the 
the vibration you had 
you came on 
strong like sun on my back 

Oh i know that things, they can get complicated 

All the less we say 
Lets Undercomplicate it

If words were all our clothes 
Then we should just get naked 
Now 

Your mind is a vacation 
Love the way you say shit 
Even if I hate it 
It’s Something i can bathe in  

Your vulnerability is sexy to me 
Say whats on your mind so explicitly 
Your my horizon, my favorite scene 
Yeah You take me places 

License plate from Indiana 
forgive me I’ve left all my manners 
deep in my secrets i see you in love
Maybe i’m there to i cant even front

you can pretend i’m rihanna 
play with me like you’re santana
never could shake the 
the vibration you had 
you came on 
strong like sun on my back 

pineapple crush
pineapple crush 

License plate from Indiana 
forgive me I’ve left all my manners 
deep in my secrets i see you in love
Maybe i’m there to i cant even front
